question: Which proteins are markers of myositis?
ideal_answer: Blood tests showed significantly increased CK and aldolase values in patients with myositis (p < 0.001 and p < 0.0001).

snippets.text: Biological markers such as serum creatine phosphokinase (CPK) are commonly used to measure muscular tissue injury.
Cardiac Troponin I and T in Checkpoint Inhibitor-associated Myositis and Myocarditis.
Blood tests showed significantly increased CK and aldolase values in patients with myositis (p < 0.001 and p < 0.0001).
